activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:02 PM Defendant Jerome C. Thoms in court. Attorney Brian David Van Ells appeared by video for Jerome C. Thoms. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Ells states has not received discovery - sent request in July. Schiek will look into discovery issue. Bond continued. adj. 02:03 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:37 PM Defendant Jerome C. Thoms in court. Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court for Jerome C. Thoms. Defendant Sierra S. Thoms appears by video, in custody. Attorney Lonnie D Story appears by video for Sierra Thoms. Attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 22F142, 22CF122, 22CF141. Court statement. Van Ells-defendant Jerome Thoms waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver free and voluntary; finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Court notes Attorney Story has submitted written Waiver of Preliminary Hearing for Defendant Sierra Thoms-defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver free and voluntary; finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Court notes the reduction of bond motion filed in 22CF141 by Atty. Story. Sowinski notes Information will mirror criminal complaints. Van Ells willing to proceed to arraignment; speaks to bond motion lift no contact provision with Sierra. Story willing to proceed with arraignment. Van Ells - defendant pleads not guilty to all charges. Story - waives reading and defendant pleads not guilty to all charges. Story statement to bond reduction in 22CF141-requests $2,000 cash. Sowinski statement to bond reduction. Court statement - reduces bond to $3,000 cash in 22CF141. Court strikes no contact provision in both bonds. Van Ells clarifies there is no no contact provision/withdraws bond motion. Court statement. Counsel allowed to appear by Zoom for next hearing. adj. 1:57 p.m.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jerome C. Thoms in court. Attorney Brian David Van Ells appeared by video for Jerome C. Thoms. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Bail continued. adj. 01:24 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Judge re: bond reduction

1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jerome C. Thoms appeared by video, in custody. Court states Defendant appeared yesterday and set bond yesterday. Complaint has been filed. In receipt of complaint. Explained right to counsel yesterday. Defendant statement to bond. Sowinski statement to bond. Court denies motion to modify bond. adj. 01:38 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
